Components.Abstract.PanelTree

Class CPanelTreeComp

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Components.Abstract.PanelTree.CPanelTreeComp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPanelTreeComp, IPAMOJAComponent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class CPanelTreeComp
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, IPAMOJAComponent, IPanelTreeComp, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    A special kind of tree editor which displays an AST of a program as a hierarchy of nested panels and allows graphical editing of the AST.

    In each panel it writes the program text specific to that panel. It is composed of two subcomponents:

    • AST2BoxTree component - a mapping which yields an intermediate box tree which acts as a building plan for the panel tree.
    • Box2PanelTree component - a mapping from a box tree to a panel tree.
    A PanelTree component collaborates with a Language and a Presentation component to generate structured formatted text. When it observes a change in the AST of a TreeEditor it regenerates the panel tree to correspond to the structure of the AST. Additionally, it interacts with a TreeEditor to allow structural editing of programs using mouse operations.
    See Also:
    CAST2BoxTreeComp, CLanguageComp, CPresentationComp, CTreeEditorComp, Serialized Form

      • propertyChange

        public void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent evt)
        Handle property change events from CoreHybridEditor, Language and Presentation Components. If the property change is from:
        • CoreHybridEditor - if property is ast or focusretrieve its AST and update the panel tree. If property is structualEditing, update the panel tree mode.
        • Language - retrieve the lexeme and terminal definitions from the Language component and (re)create this panel tree.
        • Presentation - retrieve box patterns and symbol styles from the Presentation component and (re)create this panel tree.
        Specified by:
        propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
        Parameters:
        evt - event object with the new value
